label: Description
value: Repeats of lotus and other indistinct ornaments filled with fancy weave patterns - the satin backgound is black - wefts are light blue and rose tan.

value: Gift of Mrs. Harry T. Peters

label: Description
value: A fragment from a set of vestments found at the Cathedral of Lerida. A central band of eight-pointed stars enclosing rampant lions, separated by cross-shaped ornaments. Above, a band of pseudo-Kufic letters in white on gold ground. A narrow checked band below.  In blue, pink, and yellow silk and gold metallic threads.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns (beaten gold on vellum, wrapped around silk core) Technique: plain compound weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 35.4 x 21 cm (13 15/16 x 8 1/4 in.)

Designs for engraved decoration of goldsmith's works

label: Description
value: Right par of an oblong panel with large rinceaux design with curling acanthus leaves and two putti, one of who holds a laurel wreath. At left, a design for half a watch cover, and a vertical frieze with candelabrum motif. Thin line at perimeter, cut off at left.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Scene of two shepherds and a boy among classical ruins. At right, a kneeling male figure wearing a turban crouches near a quiver of arrows. To his right, a standing figure with a shepherd's staff points his right hand towards an inscription on a curved wall. At right, a small boy in a cape holds a finger to his mouth. Behind him, a woman washes the face of a man (possibly a sculpture). Standing on the wall at upper right near a large carved urn is a cherub figure holding a bat.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Book Ornament of a Classical Ruin with the Medallion Portrait of Francesco Algarotti (1712-1764)

label: Description
value: Portrait to right; behind the head is printed 10-letter word in Greek alphabet.  Under the medallioin is a relief showing a compass, a wreath, and a lyre.
